item.title: No Through Road sign fallen over, 22nd December
item.description:
///Cyclones.pesky.logo - was formerly a through road eastward to the A38. Some years ago that was changed and it no longer connects to the A38. Some people still use old maps and they come up this road by mistake. When they reach the end there is no place to turn around. I attach a photo of the rusted old-fashioned sign that is sometimes propped up against a tree. Drivers often miss this sign and then get stuck at the end of the road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Deerhurst, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree is damaged problem, 22nd December
item.description:
email rec 19/12/2023 - In my opinion the trees on Coxs Way require some attention. A number of the trees look either diseased, being strangled by creeping ivy and some are now leaning. My fear is that during events of extremely high winds one or more trees could fall causing damage to residents cars or property or possible injury to pedestrians. These trees are quite high and could easily reach properties on both Coxs Way and Ellison Close. Again, in my opinion these trees should be professionally pollarded and/ or have the top 20/25 foot lopped off in order to avert the aforementioned instances occurring.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The sign is illegible problem, 22nd December
item.description:
email rcvd 20.12.23 - Good evening, I'm writing to highlight an issue that has been created with the works completed at the above junction. Before the work (see photo 1) there was a clear 'no right turn' sign for those vehicles driving East along the A40. This prevented them turning right into the Shell garage. After the improvement works (or possibly when the traffic signal was replaced after a recent accident?) there is no sign highlighting it is no right turn (photo 2). We have witnessed numerous incidents of vehicles attempting and / or actually turning right into the Shell garage. This obviously risks the vehicles behind and those in the oncoming traffic. Could you investigate please and see what could be done before a more serious accident occurs? Thanks
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cracked, uneven, sunken and damaged pavement by busy stop and post box on Nine Elms Road near the Greyhound junction., 21st December
item.description:
Hello In the past few (since 16th) days there has been damage and degrading conditions to the pavement, by the post box and bus stop at Nine Elms Road (by the Greyhound pub junction) . I'm concerned with the postbox, bus stop and the kids bikes that further damage to the current state of the pavement could result in injury.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Nine Elms Road, Elmbridge, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Uncompleted works, 21st December
item.description:
Following a previous enquiry I received this message this afternoon Enquiry Update - Completion of Works - Enquiry 22035144 The repair team have been here for 3 days but haven’t repaired deep pot holes along a 15 metre stretch of road… plus may be others further along Old Brockhampton Road I spoke to them yesterday and they said they were aware of these potholes but now have not repaired them. They also commented that they where using 6mm tarmac which for the farm traffic that constantly uses the road probably wasn’t sufficient and should be 10mm… every other repair done on our road has failed within 2 years
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Old Brockhampton Road, Sudeley, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
